author: Lucas Beyer (bl16) @giffmana
text:
something I think the coding agents should add in 2026: MEMORIES(.)md.

Pretty much like ChatGPT memories, but for code projects. When I tell them "that's good, but I want the API of `foobar` to strictly not change, redo it again without changing `foobar`." it should add "don't change `foobar` API" to MEMORIES(.)md so it will remember across sessions.

In principle, it's a lot like AGENTS(.)md, but I shouldn't have to keep adding stuff to it manually, the LLM agent should manage it continuously based on our interactions.

This also fits the now self-proclaimed theme of 2026 "continual learning". So yall should just do it @thsottiaux  @bcherny
